timeline.bodyText: What do you call an OSS reference? The OSSKeyStore has the added ability to decode a key wrapped with the master key retrieved from OSS but there is no possibility to fetch a key directly from OSS.
timeline.author: hbs
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -45,22 +45,22 @@ warp.hash.token = hex:hhhhhh...
 warp.hash.app = hex:hhhhhh...
 
 //
-// 256 bits key for protecting tokens, format is hex:hhhh...hhhh
+// Key to use for protecting tokens (128/192/256 bits in hex or OSS reference)

replies.bodyText:
Yes, you're right, I took this from other configuration keys but it is clearly not the good terminology.
7c89ce4 should fix that.
replies.author: ftence

timeline.message: Improve comments for the configuration of keys
